page.title: 04A FARM IN COTTINGLEY
page.content: The date is the 7th June 1985. Charlotte and Melanie are on their way to a farm in{Cottingley.} We met the farmer in the farmyard. He cleaned his wellies and we went inside. They have 200 cattle and 138 sheep and lambs. The sheep are Scotch half breeds and lambing season is February to March. He said they usually get about 1 3/4 lambs per ewe.The sheep have to be dipped once a year by law, but at this farm they are dipped twice, in June and October, in an approved sheep dip. The sheep are sheared with electric and hand shears. They can catch {FOOTROT,LAMB DYSENTRY {PULPY KIDNEY,TETNUS, BLACK DISEASE and {CLOSTRIDIUM OEDEMATIENS}and they have to be vaccinated against them. They eat hay, consentrates, grass and in winter, they eat silage.
